alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...GUSTY SHOWERS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MARION COUNTY THROUGH 830 AM EDT... At 800 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers capable of producing a landspout near Anthony, or near Ocala, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort McCoy, Salt Springs, Lake Delancy, Anthony, and Burbank. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM EDT for northern and northeastern Florida.
